thread.title: Birmingham manager Gianfranco Zola's future hanging by a thread as Blues owners consider a change
thread.title_full: Birmingham manager Gianfranco Zola's future hanging by a thread as Blues owners consider a change

author: Neil Moxley
title: Birmingham manager Gianfranco Zola's future hanging by a thread as Blues owners consider a change
text:
Sport Birmingham manager Gianfranco Zola's future hanging by a thread as Blues owners consider a change The Italian only took over in December but has won only two of his 18 matches at St Andrew's Share The Blues suffered a 1-1 draw at Cardiff on Saturday (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe 
Gianfranco Zola's future as Birmingham City’s boss is hanging by a thread. 
The Italian’s position is being discussed by the club’s Hong Kong owners as they consider change at the top. 
Zola took over in December but has won just two of his 18 matches – although a Lukas Jutkiewicz goal earned his side a point at Cardiff yesterday in a 1-1 draw. 
The Blues were seventh when the ex-Chelsea star assumed control – indeed, they were just three points off second place. Zola only took charge at St Andrew's in December (Photo: PA) Read More Zola alters training schedule in bid to save job 
But Zola has overseen a collapse and the club’s Hong Kong owners are deciding whether to act. 
The new boss tried to implement a more entertaining style but a horrific run has left them just six points off the bottom three. poll loading Will Gianfranco Zola see out the season at Birmingham? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
